title: 112_hr6217
content: The Act titled "Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act" requires the purchase of green technologies with 85 percent domestic content for use by the federal government and states. The Act mandates that green technologies purchased by the Federal Government and states must have 85 percent domestic content. During the first three fiscal years after the enactment of the Act, the requirement for green technologies purchased by the Federal Government and states will phase in gradually, starting at 30 percent in the first year, 50 percent in the second year, and 80 percent in the third year. Green technologies are defined as renewable energy and energy efficiency products that reduce dependence on unreliable sources of energy. The Act encourages the use of sustainable renewable energy sources and energy efficiency products, including biomass, wind, hydroelectric, solar, geothermal, and hybrid fossil-renewable energy systems. The section applies to purchases of green technologies starting from October 1 of the first fiscal year after the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. Renewable energy production and investment tax credits limited to domestically produced property. The Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to require that 85 percent of a facility's manufacturing and materials be from the United States to qualify for renewable energy production tax credits. The Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act requires a certain percentage of a facility's manufacturing and materials to be from the United States to qualify for renewable energy production tax credits. For facilities placed in service before January 1, 2015, there are transitional rules that adjust the percentage requirements based on the year the facility was originally placed in service. The Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act mandates that 85 percent of property must be manufactured in the United States to qualify for energy tax credits. Transitional rules apply for facilities placed in service before January 1, 2015. The Make it in America Act mandates that for periods in 2012, 30 percent of property must be manufactured in the US to qualify for energy tax credits, for 2013 it's 50 percent, and for 2014 it's 80 percent. These changes apply to facilities placed in service after the enactment of the Act. The Act requires property to be manufactured in the US to qualify for energy tax credits, following rules similar to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
